member.name: T:ResendMT.My.MyWebExtension
member.summary: Module used to define the properties that are available in the My Namespace for Web projects.

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.AttachParameters(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary:
This method is used to attach array of SqlParameters to a SqlCommand.
This method will assign a value of DbNull to any parameter with a direction of InputOutput and a value of null.
This behavior will prevent default values from being used, but this will be the less common case than an intended pure output parameter (derived as InputOutput) where the user provided no input value.
member.param: The command to which the parameters will be added
An array of SqlParameters to be added to command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: This method assigns dataRow column values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
The dataRow used to hold the stored procedure's parameter values

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.AssignParameterValues(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Object[])
member.summary: This method assigns an array of values to an array of SqlParameters
member.param: Array of SqlParameters to be assigned values
Array of objects holding the values to be assigned

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.PrepareCommand(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method opens (if necessary) and assigns a connection, transaction, command type and parameters to the provided command
member.param: The SqlCommand to be prepared
A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
true if the connection was opened by the method, otherwose is false.

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns no resultset) against the database specified in the connection string using the provided parameters
member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders", new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)

member.remarks: e.g.: int result = ExecuteNonQuery(conn, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "PublishOrders");
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: An int representing the number of rows affected by the command

An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command

member.name: F:ResendMT.SQLHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.Internal
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by SqlHelper

member.name: F:ResendMT.SQLHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership.External
member.summary: Connection is owned and managed by the caller

member.name: T:ResendMT.SQLHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership
member.summary: This enum is used to indicate whether the connection was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper, so that we can set the appropriate CommandBehavior when calling ExecuteReader()

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[],ResendMT.SQLHelper.SqlConnectionOwnership)
member.summary: Create and prepare a SqlCommand, and call ExecuteReader with the appropriate CommandBehavior.
member.remarks:
If we created and opened the connection, we want the connection to be closed when the DataReader is closed.
If the caller provided the connection, we want to leave it to them to manage.
member.param: A valid SqlConnection, on which to execute this command
A valid SqlTransaction, or 'null'
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParameters to be associated with the command or 'null' if no parameters are required
Indicates whether the connection parameter was provided by the caller, or created by SqlHelper
member.returns: SqlDataReader containing the results of the command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String)
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: SqlDataReader dr = ExecuteReader(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders");
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
member.returns: A SqlDataReader containing the resultset generated by the command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[])
member.summary: Execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset and takes no parameters) against the database specified in the connection string.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(connString, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"});
member.param: A valid connection string for a SqlConnection
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.FillDataset(System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[],System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])

The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.FillDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Data.DataSet,System.String[],System.Data.SqlClient.SqlParameter[])
member.summary: Private helper method that execute a SqlCommand (that returns a resultset) against the specified SqlTransaction and SqlConnection using the provided parameters.
member.remarks: e.g.: FillDataset(conn, trans, CommandType.StoredProcedure, "GetOrders", ds, new string[] {"orders"}, new SqlParameter("@prodid", 24));
member.param: A valid SqlConnection
A valid SqlTransaction
The CommandType (stored procedure, text, etc.)
The stored procedure name or T-SQL command
A dataset wich will contain the resultset generated by the command
This array will be used to create table mappings allowing the DataTables to be referenced by a user defined name (probably the actual table name)
An array of SqlParamters used to execute the command

member.name: M:ResendMT.SQLHelper.UpdateDataset(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Executes the respective command for each inserted, updated, or deleted row in the DataSet.
member.remarks: e.g.: UpdateDataset(conn, insertCommand, deleteCommand, updateCommand, dataSet, "Order");
member.param: A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to insert new records into the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure to delete records from the data source
A valid transact-SQL statement or stored procedure used to update records in the data source
The DataSet used to update the data source
The DataTable used to update the data source.
